    Slope-hunter collider bias method

    slopehunter.Rd

    The Slope-hunter method has it's own R package and does not need to be re-implemented. I have re-written it here primarily for my own learning and to implement new plotting functions, such as the iteration plotting output.
    Run the SlopeHunter expectation-maximization method to estimate the bias adjustment factor. The algorithm uses model-based clustering and proposes that the distributions of the incidence(GI) and progression (GP) BETAs can be written like so:

    \( \binom{\beta_{GI}}{\beta'_{GI}} \sim \pi_{1}N \begin{pmatrix} \underline{0}, \begin{bmatrix} \sigma_{I}^{2} & b_{1}\sigma_{I}^{2} \\ b_1\sigma_{I}^{2} & b_{1}^{2}\sigma_{I}^{2} \\ \end{bmatrix} \end{pmatrix} + \pi_{2}N \begin{pmatrix} \underline{0}, \begin{bmatrix} \sigma_{I}^{2} & b_{1}\sigma_{I}^{2} + \sigma_{IP} \\ b_1\sigma_{I}^{2} + \sigma_{IP} & b_{1}^{2}\sigma_{I}^{2} + \sigma_{P}^{2} + 2b_{1}\sigma_{IP} \\ \end{bmatrix} \end{pmatrix} + \pi_{3} \begin{pmatrix} \eta_{0} \\ N(0, \sigma_{P}^{2}) \end{pmatrix} + \pi_{4} \begin{pmatrix} \eta_{0} \\ \eta_{0} \end{pmatrix} \)

    • Cluster 1: SNPs that cause incidence but not progression

    • Cluster 2: SNPs that cause incidence and progression

    • Cluster 3: SNPs that cause progression but not incidence

    • Cluster 4: SNPs that cause neither incidence or progression

    • The values \(\pi_{1}, \pi_{2}, \pi_{3}, \pi_{4}\) are the probabilities that a SNP belongs to the respective clusters.

    The first thing to note is that we can filter out SNPs from cluster 3 and 4 by only including SNPs with a significant association (P-value) with incidence - this is the ip parameter. The problem is then reduced to finding two clusters that best fit distributions 1 and 2 of the equation above. The SlopeHunter EM algorithm iteratively determines which SNPs belong to each distribution (probabilistically) and once complete the adjustment factor (slope gradient) can be determined from group 1, i.e. only those SNPs thought to solely cause incidence.
    This function's code is adapted from the SlopeHunter R package and if using this method the SlopeHunter package should be referenced as the original source (see references).

    slopehunter(
  gwas_i,
  gwas_p,
  merge = c(CHR = "CHR", BP = "BP"),
  ip = 0.001,
  pi0 = 0.6,
  sxy1 = 1e-05,
  bootstraps = 100,
  seed = 2023
)

    Arguments

    gwas_i

    a data.frame like object, clumped incidence GWAS summary statistics in standardise_gwas() format

    gwas_p

    a data.frame like object, progression GWAS summary statistics in standardise_gwas() format

    merge

    a named character vector c(gwas1_col=gwas2_col) of the columns to join on; e.g. c("CHR1"="CHR2","BP1"="BP2"); can be NULL, in which case the gwases must be data.tables and already have keys set

    ip

    a numeric, range 0-1, the initial p-value by which to filter the incidence GWAS

    pi0

    a numeric, range 0-1, the initial weight / percentage of SNPs that affect incidence only

    sxy1

    a numeric, the initial (guess) of the covariance between incidence and progression BETAs

    bootstraps

    a whole-number numeric, the number of bootstrap samples to estimate the SE of the adjustment factor (can be zero, in which case no SE is returned)

    seed

    an integer, seed for reproducibility

    Value

    an S3 ColliderBiasResult object

    References

    https://github.com/Osmahmoud/SlopeHunter/blob/b0686fe0c7a4e6d056d902765ba9cd0a0b35ad5c/R/SH-utils.R#L53

    https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-022-28119-9
